module.name: AVR Interface
module.description: Interface to the AVR (for the default firmware). This give you access to the USB port and analog pins on the Mojo.

module.name: Register Interface
module.description: Turn a basic serial interface into an register (address) based interface. This can allow you to easily connect various parts of your design to the serial port by mapping them to different regions in the address space.

module.name: UART TX
module.description: UART (Serial) transmitter with configurable baud rate.

module.name: UART RX
module.description: UART (Serial) receiver with configurable baud rate.

module.name: SPI Master
module.description: SPI master. It has configurable CPOL and CPHA as well as a configurable clock divider.

module.name: SPI Slave
module.description: SPI slave. It has configurable CPOL and CPHA. It's used to interface with the AVR on the Mojo.

module.name: I2C Master
module.description: I2C master that can be used to talk to I2C devices. It has a configurable clock divider.

module.name: I2C Slave
module.description: I2C slave that can be used to interface with an I2C master. It has a configurable devices ID. After a byte is read, you need to tell the module if it should respond with a byte or wait for more bytes to be read. See the EDID ROM module in the Video category for an example use case.

module.name: SCCB
module.description: Serial Camera Control Bus. This module allows you to write to a camera's registers using the SCCB protocol. It currently only supports writes.

module.name: SDRAM Controller
module.description: An SDRAM controller for interfacing with the SDRAM Shield which uses the MT48LC32M8A2P-7E:G SDRAM chip. This module assumes that the clock is 100MHz and the SDRAM Shield is connected directly to the Mojo (first in the stack).

module.name: Servo Controller
module.description: A fully customizable servo controller. It offers glitch-free operation of PWM servos with parameters to easily adjust the neutral, minimum, and maximum pulse widths.

module.name: Pulse Width Modulator
module.description: PWM module with glitch free updates. Offers a configurable clock divider, max value, and resolution

module.name: PWM Wave
module.description: Fancy wave effect for 8 LEDs. This is the default effect that ships on the Mojo.

module.name: Simple RAM
module.description: Simple single port RAM with configurable size and depth.

module.name: Simple Dual-port RAM
module.description: Simple dual port RAM with configurable size and depth. These are useful when you need to be able to read and write independently.

module.name: Asynchronous FIFO
module.description: A FIFO (First In First Out) with independent clocks for writing and reading. These are useful for crossing clock domains.

module.name: Memory Write Buffer
module.description: A FIFO style write buffer that can be used to pad bursty write patterns to memory or to deal with the occasional delay from SDRAM refresh cycles.

module.name: Memory Arbiter
module.description: This module allows you to connect multiple clients to a single memory interface (the interface used by the SDRAM controller). It uses a simple priority scheme where each client gets a unique priority (lower IDs = higher priority). This means it is possible for high priority clients to starve out low priority clients.

module.name: Pseudo-random Number Generator
module.description: This is a pseudo-random number generator using the Xorshift algorithm (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xorshift). It generates 32 bit "random" numbers that should be random enough for most purposes, but shouldn't be used for any crypto applications. A seed can be provided to dynamically change the set of random numbers generated after a reset.

module.name: OV2640 Interface
module.description: This is an interface for the OV2640 camera. It will automatically configure the camera on power up and start sending image data to your design. This modules requires that one of the configuration ROMs below be included in your project. The different ROMs will determine the resolution that the images are captured at.

module.name: OV2640 UXGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take UXGA (1600x1200) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 SXGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take SXGA (1280x1024) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 XGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take XGA (1024x768) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 SVGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take SVGA (800x600) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 VGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take VGA (640x480) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 CIF Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take CIF (352x288) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 QVGA Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take QVGA (320x240) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: OV2640 QCIF Configuration ROM
module.description: This a ROM containing the configuration data for the OV2640 to get it to take QCIF (176x144) size images at 15FPS.

module.name: HDMI Encoder
module.description: This module can encode video data for an HDMI stream. You can set the resolution through its parameters.

module.name: HDMI Decoder
module.description: This module will recover HDMI data and the associated clock.

module.name: HDMI Passthru
module.description: This module can be used to edit an HDMI video stream. It decodes the data, allows you to edit it, then encodes it again. You can define the number of cycles you need to edit the stream through its parameters.

module.name: EDID ROM
module.description: Example EDID ROM for use with HDMI Decoder. This ROM will tell a source that the Mojo is a 720p60 capable monitor.

module.name: DVI Encoder
module.description: Encodes video data into a DVI stream. You most likely should be using the HDMI Encoder module instead of this directly.

module.name: DVI Decoder
module.description: Decodes a DVI stream into video data. You most likely should be using the HDMI Decoder module instead of this directly.

module.name: Serdes N to 1
module.description: Serializer from 1-8 to 1 bit.

module.name: TMDS Encoder
module.description: Encodes 8 bits of data into 10 bits of TMDS data.

module.name: DVI Globals
module.description: DVI global constants.

module.name: FIFO 2x Reducer
module.description: Crosses from a clock domain of FREQ to a clock domain of 2*FREQ by halving the data width.

module.name: TMDS Decoder
module.description: Decodes 10 bit TMDS data into the original 8 bits.

module.name: Serdes 1 to 5
module.description: Deserializer from 1 bit to 5. Input data is a differential signal and supports bit slips to align 5 bit packets.

module.name: Channel Align
module.description: Aligns data across multiple TMDS channels.

module.name: Bit Align
module.description: Aligns TMDS bits from a deserializer.

module.name: Register Interface (Debug)
module.description: Turn a basic serial interface into an register (address) based interface. This can allow you to easily connect various parts of your design to the serial port by mapping them to different regions in the address space. The debug version allows your to add use the IDE's built-in Wave Capture tool to view signals in the FPGA.

module.name: Wave Capture
module.description: Plugs into the Register Interface and allows you to capture and view signals inside the FPGA using the IDE's built-in Wave Capture tool. You generally should use "Register Interface (Debug)" instead of using this component directly.

module.name: Counter
module.description: Configurable counter module. It can count up or down and has an adjustable size, max value, and clock divider.

module.name: Pipeline
module.description: Pipeline with configurable depth. It will delay a signal for a specified number of clock cycles. It's also useful to synchronizing external inputs.

module.name: Edge Detector
module.description: An edge detector that can be configured to detect rising, falling, or both types of edges.

module.name: Decoder
module.description: Binary to 1-hot decoder with a configurable input width.

module.name: Encoder
module.description: 1-hot to binary encoder with a configurable input width.

module.name: Arbiter
module.description: Basic arbiter that takes an input and outputs a 1 where the most-significant 1 is in the input. For example, an input of 0110 would create an output of 0100.

module.name: CCLK Detector
module.description: Detects when the CCLK signal has been high long enough to ensure the AVR is ready.

module.name: Button Conditioner
module.description: This module will clean up an input from a button. It will both synchronize and debounce the signal. The debounce timeout is configurable as well as the length of the synchronizer.

module.name: Reset Conditioner
module.description: This will take an asynchronous reset input (such as a button) and synchronize the falling edge to the clock. This is important to ensure that the entire FPGA comes out of reset at the same time.

module.name: Binary to Decimal
module.description: This module converts a binary number into a series of decimal numbers. This is helpful for displaying a binary number on seven-segment displays or printing it to the USB port.

module.name: Memory Bus
module.description: Memory bus for the interfacing with the SDRAM controller.
